game.desc: 2048 is played on a simple gray 4×4 grid, with numbered tiles that slide smoothly when a player moves them using the four arrow keys. Every turn, a new tile will randomly appear in an empty spot on the board with a value of either 2 or 4. Tiles slide as far as possible in the chosen direction until they are stopped by either another tile or the edge of the grid. If two tiles of the same number collide while moving, they will merge into a tile with the total value of the two tiles that collided. The resulting tile cannot merge with another tile again in the same move. (source Wikipedia).

game.name: 65536 In 1
game.desc: 65536 glorious games packed into less than 60kB! The result is a consistent experience comparable to those chinese cartridges we used to buy in the 90s and early 00s with a ludicrous amount of games, some good, some bad. Figuring out the games is supposed to be part of the fun, like it was back in the day when you didn't have the manual.

game.name: Arkanoid
game.desc: The classic arcade game ported to the Uzebox. There's no enemies though due to RAM and CPU limitations.

game.name: Atomix
game.desc: Logical puzzle, goal is to build molecule of atoms. 50 levels (by Andreas Wuest) Status of each level (if is done) is saved in EEPROM. Counting moves, distance and time in level

game.name: Babylon Tower
game.desc: Babylon Tower is a puzzle game where the goal is to line up colored balls 5 in a row either horizontally or vertically. All balls are inside movable rings that can rotate on 1 axis. There is an additional ring with a cutaway that can be used to move a ball from one column to the next.

game.name: B.C. Dash
game.desc:
B.C. Dash is a platformer game that pits you against the environment as you race against the clock for the fastest time. On your hazardous journey you will negotiate all manner of awkward terrain and encounter a host of strange artifacts that may aid or ail. You must combine your swift feline reactions with the cunning of a ...snail? Yes, a snail, in order to achieve the fastest dash since Thor and Grog!
Bob B.C. Dash was originally named B.C. Bob and was to star Bob. But Bob lost his stone wheel... maybe he'll find it again at a later date.
B.C. Dash was made with the help of the Platz toolset.

game.name: Boulderdash
game.desc: A version of the classic Boulderdash game from the C64 era. Collect diamonds and don't get crushed!

game.name: Bugz
game.desc: Bugz is an all-original 2D platformer, written specifically for the Uzebox. It has 21 levels, and the object is to collect all the cookies in each level without dying. If you can finish the level before the time bonus reaches zero, you'll get a higher score. Killing the bugs will also increase your score. Includes single player, and multiplayer modes.

game.name: Chickens In Choppers
game.desc:
The whole game references a folkish song called "Cows with guns" by an artist called Dana Lyons. In the song the said cows (with guns) were evading capture so they would not be sent to Macdonalds to be turned into burgers. The final verse of the song goes
The order was given to turn cows to whoppers Enforced by the might of ten thousand coppers But on the horizon surrounding the shoppers Came the deafening roar of chickens in choppers

game.name: Chess For Uzebox
game.desc: The game chess4uzebox is implementation of well-known board game. 1 player game (player vs. CPU) / 2 player game (multiplayer on 1 or 2 controllers) / CPU vs. CPU game. 4 levels of CPU skills (ELO rating around 1060-1575 according to some position test). Option to temporarily disable display during computations, to make it faster. Demo mode (no music, no turbo, easy vs easy). Minimalistic chess engine - originally it was micro-Max by by H.G. Muller (http://home.hccnet.nl/h.g.muller/max-src2.html), ported to AVR by Andre Adrian (http://www.andreadrian.de/schach/#Selbstbau_Schachcomputer_SHAH). Full FIDE rules.

game.name: Columns
game.desc: Columns if a fast paced competitive puzzle game for 1 or 2 players. Fight to the end, crush or be crushed!

game.name: Daleks
game.desc:
You get an action which includes: a move, teleport, or use of the Sonic Screwdriver. The Daleks will then move. If Daleks occupy the same space, they crash and die. Daleks are stupid and will run into other already crashed Daleks and die as well.
The sonic screw driver can be used once be level, and will kill/remove all LIVING Dalek adjacent to the player.
To keep order to the game, you need to press "A" to confirm your move,
After all the Daleks are killed in a level, you start the next level which has more Daleks.
You can teleport any unlimited number of times, but MAY teleport into a Dalek, including a crashed Dalek, and adjacent to a Dalek which will then move and kill the player.

game.name: Boot, Das
game.desc: Das Boot is a submarine simulation which takes place in a fictional war. The eponymous german film 'Das Boot' lent the game soundtrack, title and name. In the simulation, you command a submarine in the pacific with which you must sink enemy destroyers and submarines. One of the first simulations on the Uzebox, this game uses all the memory, and input functions on gamepad.

game.name: Donkey Kong
game.desc: Donkey Kong is a re-make of the 1981 classic arcade game. Every attempt was made to keep the Uzebox version faithful to the original.
game.developer: Paul McPhee (music & sfx by Lee Weber)

game.name: Dr. Mario
game.desc: This is a remake of Dr.Mario, a classic "falling blocks" game published by Nintendo for the NES in 1990. 2 player gameplay Original gameplay rules with virus numbers configurable per player Original music

game.name: Happy Easter
game.desc: 'Happy Easter' is a small arcade game. Help the Easter bunny! animated easter bunny, chicken and falling objects hall of fame with the names and scores of 3 best players 2 sound tracks and sound effects

game.name: Final Blood
game.desc: Final Blood is a little arcade shooter which based on a small game of a 220in1 retro gaming console. Various enemies appear and drive from the left to the right edge of the screen.

game.name: Fireman Rescue
game.desc: You are part of a firemen team and you must save people jumping out of windows and extinguish all fires!

game.name: Ghosty Ghost
game.desc:
Ghosty Ghost is the epic tale of a brand new ghost who's just learning to fly... or something like that.
Simple, familiar, and addictive gameplay. Avoid the obstacles to get as far as you can and beat the top score.

game.name: Gorillas
game.desc: Gorillas is a re-make of the famous QBASIC game Gorillas developed by IBM and published by Microsoft 1991 with MS-DOS 5. 1 player mode vs CPU 2 player mode original grafic and game play original sound tracks enhanced PCM sound effects wind speed simulation

game.name: Iros
game.desc:
Iros is a platform and shooting game inspired by Solar-Warrior from Technos. It's played on and around 5 diverse planets featuring alternating stages of action platforming and space shooting.
The 5 knights of Iros have stolen your power ups and fled to their home worlds. Destroy them and take back your swag!

game.name: Iros
game.desc:
Iros is a platform and shooting game inspired by Solar-Warrior from Technos. It's played on and around 5 diverse planets featuring alternating stages of action platforming and space shooting.
The 5 knights of Iros have stolen your power ups and fled to their home worlds. Destroy them and take back your swag!

game.name: Iros
game.desc:
Iros is a platform and shooting game inspired by Solar-Warrior from Technos. It's played on and around 5 diverse planets featuring alternating stages of action platforming and space shooting.
The 5 knights of Iros have stolen your power ups and fled to their home worlds. Destroy them and take back your swag!

game.name: Joyrider
game.desc: Joyrider is an action / driving game for the Uzebox, in the style of the original Grand Theft Auto and Driver games, created by James Howard for the Uzebox Coding Competition 2014.

game.name: Lander
game.desc: Lander is a remake of the 80's ATARI game Lunar Lander. land a space ship save on the moonnn7 levels with different backgrounds, ground profiles, fuel capacity and skillsnnSoundtrack: Rocket Man, Championsnnhall of fame with the names and scores of 3 best players

game.name: Lode Runner
game.desc: Lode Runner is a remake of the classic PC/Apple II/C64 game of the same name. The player controls a character who must collect all the gold in a level while avoiding guards who try to catch him. After collecting all the gold, the player must travel to the top of the screen to reach the next level. There are 50 levels in the game which progressively challenge players' problem-solving abilities or reaction times.

game.name: Maze
game.desc: Labyrinth game!

game.name: Mega Sokoban
game.desc: Classical sokoban game with minimalistic engine and 999 levels. Simple game engine (copied from Sokoban for AVR TV Game)nnUnique level compression algorithm (average level has less than 27B, very cheap decompression)nn999 levels (selected levels from collections Microban, Sasquatch by David W. Skinner and Procedural Sokoban Level Generation - algorithmically generated by Joshua Taylor and Ian Parberry)nnCustom video engine (modified engine 5 with tile size 12x16 px and screen size 16x12 tiles, no scrolling or sprites - around 3KB of SRAM free!)nn1000 moves undo push ringbuffer (thanks to lot of free RAM)nnRemembers last opened level and state of completion (if was done) of each level in EEPROM (5 slots)

game.name: Pipes
game.desc: Pipes is an original game in the style of "Pipe Mania" aka "Pipe Dream" developed by The Assembly Line in 1989.

game.name: Pong
game.desc: A remake of the classic Pong game from 1972!

game.name: Roguze
game.desc:
Welcome to Roguze.
You are an adventurer. You've been asked by one of the gods, to travel deep into the earth, and get the sickle. You are represented by the symbol @. Explore the dungeon. When you see a monster, to attack it, simply walk into it. Find new weapons and upgrade your skills to make it to get to the bottom of the lair.

game.name: Ruby Crush
game.desc:
Ruby Crush is an open source clone of Bejeweled (or any other match-3 game). It is currently single player, with two modes: Classic and Timed.
Gameplay is more or less identical to Bejeweled, or any other match-3 games floating about. The goal is to get at least 3 gems of the same type in a horizontal or vertical row. You do this by swapping two adjacent gems. The only way you can swap a gem is if doing so would line up at least 3 gems of the same type in a row. Getting at least 3 gems in a row clears those gems, and new ones drop down from the top of the board. In both modes, you can get a hint about which gem can be moved to score some points. Note that this is not necessarily the best move possible, it's just *a* move, in case you get stuck.

game.name: Snake
game.desc: A simple snake game.

game.name: Snakes
game.desc: A simple snake game.

game.name: Storm Force
game.desc: Stormforce is a vertical shooter. Use your star fighter to fight your way through 4 levels. There are no shields, so use your 3 smartbombs and 3 lives carefully.

game.name: Submarine
game.desc: Submarine is an action game that appeared on many older game consoles.

game.name: Tank Fu
game.desc: Tank Fu is a tank-on-tank multiplayer deathmatch game. Best played with two players but also supports a single player against CPU mode. Challenge your friends to own bragging rights as Tank Fu master!

game.name: Tetris
game.desc: Tetris is a Tetris clone and a modification of the game Megatris. While Megatris is designed for 2 players, Tetris has removed any multiplayer feature and replaced it with other display options such as Lines, Score, and Level. The gameplay mechanics closely resemble those of Tetris DS for the Nintendo DS.

game.name: Tron
game.desc: Tron is an open source competitive game based on the 1982 film of the same name. The goal of the game is to get your opponent to crash into a wall (either the outer rim, or one the tails left behind your light cycles).

game.name: Uzebox Tactics
game.desc: Uzebox Tactics is a turned based strategy game which is inspired by the game Advance Wars for the Gameboy Advance. Also some games like Batle Isle, Tom Clancy's Endwar or C&C took influence. It was started in 2014 by Edward Shin unfortunately not finished. Until now!

game.name: Uze Feud
game.desc: A game similar to Family Feud for the Uzebox, it supports up to 8 players, includes original art and music, but not original questions.

game.name: Uzekickers
game.desc: Uzekickers: a Penalty Kick game

game.name: Simon
game.desc: Simon is an implementation of the electronic game Simon says also known as Senso from the 70s...

game.name: Uze Snakes
game.desc: Uze Snakes is a classic "snakes" game using mode 9.

game.name: Uzesweeper
game.desc: Uzesweeper is close remake of the classic game Minesweeper. I tried to stay true to the original while adding my own little bit of design to the feel. It has been optimized for easy menu navigation and gameplay on the Uzebox.

game.name: Videopoker
game.desc: Video Poker (based on the arcade version "Jack's or Better")

game.name: Whack-a-mole
game.desc: Adaptation of the world famous game. This game is the first one to use the SNES mouse.

game.name: Zombienator
game.desc: Zombinator is a shoot-em-up game taking place in a cemetery where you must shoot onslaughts of zombies.

game.name: Zooming Secretary
game.desc:
Zooming Secretary is an action platform game reminiscent of earlier classic arcade games, with new original concepts. This game is based on the NES port(an original title) by Shiru(programming) and Pinwizz(media). You take the role of an overworked secretary who must answer phone calls before they hang up. Each phone call requires information related to 4 different topics: Earth, History, Literature, and Space. By going to a file cabinet with the specific icon, she will acquire the information related to the topic and can answer any phone call requiring this type information.
The player will need to use quick thinking and cunning to minimize travel time between points and avoid unnecessary trips which may mean answering calls out of order or damage control sacrifices; too many failures and the secretary will be fired(though they have no replacement)! Avoid the boss who slows the secretary down with babble, the unmovable gossiper, the confusing assistant, the wreckless moving man, the creepy secret admirer....all while using healthy dosages of caffeine to speed through the level, and catch her dreamy but elusive "bad boy love interest". After all this, she is really going to need a vacation!
